item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

Try creating a new int for it. Instead of doing

player.partyhat = Misc.random(5);

Try doing this:

[code]int partyhat = Misc.random(5);
switch(partyhat) {
case 0:
Engine.playerItems.addItem(player, 1038, 1);
player.frames.sendMessage(player, “You recieve a [x1] Red Partyhat!”);
break;
case 1:
Engine.playerItems.addItem(player, 1040, 1);
player.frames.sendMessage(player, “You recieve a [x1] Yellow Partyhat!”);
break;
case 2:
Engine.playerItems.addItem(player, 1042, 1);
player.frames.sendMessage(player, “You recieve a [x1] Blue Partyhat!”);
break;
case 3:
Engine.playerItems.addItem(player, 1044, 1);
player.frames.sendMessage(player, “You recieve a [x1] Green Partyhat!”);
break;
case 4:
Engine.playerItems.addItem(player, 1046, 1);
player.frames.sendMessage(player, “You recieve a [x1] Purple Partyhat!”);
break;
case 5:
Engine.playerItems.addItem(player, 1048, 1);
player.frames.sendMessage(player, “You recieve a [x1] White Partyhat!”);
break;
}

[/code]
